intro: Onopordum bolivari, commonly known as the Bolivian thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and a tall, branching stem that bears yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Onopordum bolivari is adapted to withstand drought and high sunlight exposure, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
